title: Aside from Bismarck (and excluding Hitler) who has been the greatest German chancellor? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’d go with Konrad Adenauer,(West) Germany’s first post-war Chancellor.During his tenure in office (1949–63),(West) Germany was largely re-built and its economy restored.And he began the slow process of re-habilitating his country’s reputation by reconciling with France,providing restitution to Jews and assisting the new state of Israel,and establishing his country as a loyal member of the western alliance.Good relations with the USA were paramount in his view. Some have criticized his “go easy” policy re:ex-Nazis.And there is some basis for this criticism.But had he permanently disqualified ALL former Nazis from public life,Germany could not have functioned for another 30 years or so. Basically,the man accomplished alot with a weak hand.

What a question - to start a fight in a bar in Germany :-) And don_t bring up any question regarding politics in Germany and include ANYTHING about the period from 1933 to 1945. Having said that, the greatest chancellor of ALL time in Germany was Helmut Schmidt.
Rainald von Dassel. The good people of Milan might disagree a bit, but which other chancellor has a figure made out of gold to show his successes (on the Dreikönigsschrein in Cologne)?
